revised_title: Electro-Photometric Experiments with Chlorous Acid and Peroxide of Chlorine
tldr: The author investigates the electro-photometric properties of chlorous acid and peroxide of chlorine, discovering that the amount of current produced by light is influenced by the nature, form, and position of the poles in the cell, as well as the selective absorption, concentration, and conductivity of the fluid. The study also reveals that the addition of certain salts and acids can modify the current's amount and direction.
